summary: This is a December 16, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, reproducing discovery materials due to a Bates stamping error. The materials include Deutsche Bank records related to Jeffrey Epstein and a UBS subpoena return. The letter is designated as confidential under the case's protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the letter, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and accused sex trafficker; Deutsche Bank materials relating to him are included in the reproduced discovery.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed on the letter from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed on the letter from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed on the letter from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed on the letter from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, addressed on the letter from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case involving Epstein, and discovery includes Epstein's financial records, indicating their alleged criminal association.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in the case.
Cohen is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in the case.
Menninger is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in the case.
Pagliuca is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in the case.
Sternheim is listed as defense counsel for Maxwell in the case.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office reproduces and sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, including Deutsche Bank records on Jeffrey Epstein and a UBS subpoena return.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the confidentiality of discovery materials.

locations: 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was producing discovery materials, including Deutsche Bank records related to Jeffrey Epstein, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The production was prompted by an error in Bates stamping the original documents.
The materials were governed by a confidential protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The discovery included a UBS subpoena return dated December 15, 2020.
The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
